member.name: T:Spectre.Console.Flow.FlowRunner
member.summary: Runs operation flow given initial steps and properties. A CLI commands are responsible for initializing flows with starting step(s) and properties containing applicable CLI arguments.

member.name: T:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlow
member.summary: The flow object that drives operation steps and asks for user input when some data is needed at some step.

member.name: P:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlow.Context
member.summary: Provides access to current flow properties and state.

member.name: P:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlow.CurrentStepId
member.summary: Currently executing step.

member.name: P:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlow.IsComplete
member.summary: Returns true if flow was executed until the very last step.

member.name: M:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlow.RunAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Start the operation flow.

member.name: T:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowContext
member.summary: Flow context object that contains all data gathered from user input by operation steps.

member.name: P:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowContext.Navigation
member.summary: Navigation object controls available navigation options (back, exit etc) and helps steps to add corresponding navigation user choices when applicable.

member.name: P:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowContext.Properties
member.summary: Context properties gathered during flow execution and used at the end to run an operation.

member.name: T:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowNavigation
member.summary: Navigation object that helps controlling/displaying navigation options to user.

member.name: P:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowNavigation.Back
member.summary: When true Back option is available.

member.name: P:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowNavigation.Exit
member.summary: When true Exit option is available.

member.name: M:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowNavigation.AddPromptChoices``1(Spectre.Console.SelectionPrompt{Spectre.Console.Flow.FlowStepOption{``0}})
member.summary: Adds all available navigation options into specified prompt.

member.name: M:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowNavigation.AddPromptChoices``1(Spectre.Console.MultiSelectionPrompt{Spectre.Console.Flow.FlowStepOption{``0}})
member.summary: Adds all available navigation options into specified prompt.

member.name: T:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowStep
member.summary: A flow step responsible for collecting some corresponding piece of data and ask for user input if needed.

member.name: P:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowStep.Id
member.summary: Unique step ID.

member.name: P:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowStep.DisplayName
member.summary: Friendly step name (used in breadcrumbs).

member.name: M:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowStep.ValidateUserInputAsync(Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns true if this step is missing some data and needs user to input it.

member.name: M:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowStep.RunAsync(Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes this step and returns a result which could be Success/Failure or one of the navigation states Back/Exit etc.

member.name: M:Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowStep.ResetAsync(Spectre.Console.Flow.IFlowContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Called when we go back in navigation flow to clear some data that step added to the context.

member.name: T:Spectre.Console.Flow.Styles
member.summary:
To have consistent colors (and other markup styles), we have this helper class that replaces all known aliases with actual Spectre.Console color/markup tokens. This way when some special style needs to be applied to some output, we apply aliases instead of hardcoded Spectre tokens.
Changing color/markup value once in this file would change all appearances.

member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Spectre.Console.Flow.Resources.Strings.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.
